conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render clearly shows vertical walls with thickness, a perceptible interior volume, and an angled view with the roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have height and thickness (5). Floors clearly separate from walls (3). Interior volume clearly perceivable (4). Proper 3D wall corner geometry (3). Angled view (5). Interior visible (3). Minimal severe perspective distortion (2). Roof cleanly removed (5). Interior spaces fully visible (3). Clean geometry (2).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Correct number of rooms and adjacency (7). Relative room proportions preserved (3). Major room identities matched (2). Major wall positions align (5). Wall lengths proportional (3). Internal partitions mostly correct, with minor deviations (2 of 2). Doors present and mostly on correct walls, but some are missing (3 of 4). Windows present and on correct walls (2). Openings proportionally sized and oriented (2).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofas, tables) (4). Kitchen elements present (2). Bathroom fixtures present (2). Furniture placed in correct rooms (3). Furniture scale reasonable (1 of 2, some feel a bit small). Orientation logical (1 of 2).

visual_clarity.notes: Walls, floors, openings clearly distinguishable (4). Geometry readable (4). Interior clearly visible (3). Lighting does not obscure geometry (3). Consistent material usage (2). No major rendering artifacts (2). Clean background (0, black background is acceptable, but there are some text elements) A score of 2 is given as the background is mostly clean but there are text mentions, resulting in a reduction of 0 points.

detected_errors.description: Some internal doors are missing/not represented in the 3D model (e.g. door to bedroom 1 and bedroom 2, door to MBEDROOM).
Some windows are not perfectly matching the 2D plan in placement or count around the balconies/utility areas.
The balcony configuration on the left side of the Master Bedroom is simplified in the 3D, losing the stepped outline and outer wall.
The 'UTILITY' room next to the kitchen has a different wall configuration in 3D compared to 2D; it seems to have an additional wall segment in the 3D.
Balconies have simplified railing designs compared to the 2D representation.
Furniture scale is sometimes smaller than optimal (e.g., beds, sofa), making rooms feel larger than they might be for proportionate furniture.

summary: The 3D conversion successfully transforms the 2D plan into a clear isometric cutaway, demonstrating good geometric accuracy in layout and room configuration, with minor discrepancies in specific wall details and door placements.
